reviewText: I didn't want to see this film, but I had no choice. i thought the male anatomy was something that couldn't be shown in an R-rated film. Boy, was I wrong. The male anatomy should be kept inside the pants. This film ranks with Scarface (1983) is being one of the worst movies I've ever seen. There were only a few genuinely funny moments. The scene with the fish was also disgusting. Don't waste your time viewing this garbage.

I just saw this movie yesterday and it was the funniest movie I have ever seen in my life.  I admit I like raunchy humor, but, to me, what really makes this movie hilarious are the real reactions from people. I was laughing until tears were streaming down my face and my stomach muscles hurt from laughing so hard all throughout the movie.  I had never seen a "Jackass" movie before, but I think Johnny Knoxville is a genius and the child actor playing his grandson was completely believable and brilliant. I want this movie in my permanent collection. Up to this point, Billy Bob Thornton's "Bad Santa" was my favorite all-time comedy, but this one is even better than Bad Santa. All the high jinks these two get into on their road trip are just hysterical. So, let loose and let yourself enjoy this with some big old belly laughs, people. It is such a hoot!

This film is disgustingly funny and wrong on so many levels. Grandpa (Johnny Knoxville) is saddled with young Billy (Jackson Nicoll) until Billie's mom (Georgina Cates) gets out of prison. Grandpa opts to pass on the kid to the biological father. This requires a road trip from Lincoln, Nebraska to Raleigh. The trip consists of skits and/or practical jokes. Grandpa did gags that looked like something Willi P. Richardson would do if he was being filmed, while Billy reminded me of the kid in Jimmy Kimmel gags.

Most of the supporting cast played themselves which made me believe some of these may have been actual stunts as the camera quality wasn't good. This is a film for those who enjoy low brow humor.

Parental Guide: F-bomb. Male nudity.

It was last year when I went with my family to go see the reboot of "The Three Stooges." For the entire 5-10 minute car trip home, I could not stop laughing, to the point where I had to make myself focus on my breathing so I wouldn't choke. The point being, that was the last time I remember a movie making me laugh so riotously, and I thought it would take years for me to find another. Low and behold, Johnny Knoxville and the rest of the "Jackass" crew nearly made me pass out from laughter with their latest masterpiece of raunch.

"Bad Grandpa" follows Irving, a crotchety old man who has recently been widowed, much to his delight. His aspirations of sleeping with everything living, breathing and female are cut short, however, by his daughter being sent to prison (again.) This wouldn't be a problem if she didn't have a son whose deadbeat father was across the country, but much to the grandfather's chagrin, that's precisely the case. And so begins a cross-country journey with Irving and eight year-old Billy, who can never quite seem to go anywhere without getting in some sort ridiculous antics. Whether it being trying to move Irving's dead wife from his trunk to a hotel room, or putting Billy in drag to win money in a child beauty pageant, the hijinks in this movie are among the best in a modern comedy.

What makes these moments even more special is that, for the most part, Knoxville and company made the very wise decision to stage this in a "Borat"-like fashion. This means that all of the shocked, bewildered, and offended reactions you see on camera were not staged, which is surprising when taking into consideration some of the things that they get away with here. A funeral is crashed in the most heinously inappropriate way possible, a kiddie ride goes haywire and crashes through a store window, and a farting competition in a restaurant results in explosive wall defecation. Just when you think this movie can't get any more over the top, it winks at you and laughs, then does something completely unexpected and out of the blue. It keeps upping its own ante, which is exactly what makes these kinds of flicks work.

Even more of a delight is the fact that there is, believe it or not, a soul to this movie. The cross-country road trip with Irving and Billy is refreshingly touching at times, showing some of the signature heart that Knoxville typically displays in his non-"Jackass" outings. The writers wisely stayed away from making fun of the mother and father's situation too much, probably realizing that this is a very real reality for many children. Instead, we get to see an old geezer and a reckless little boy duke it out, then realize over time that they actually are very fond of each other. It's pretty touching at times, and while it certainly isn't anything groundbreaking, it's still a sort of feel-good movie.

That isn't to say everything here is great. Some gags get overused a bit too much, such as Billy trying to pick up women for his grandfather, and the continuous usage of the dead grandmother prop. There are also occasionally jokes that just don't work that well, like Knoxville wrangling a fish that has a massive human penis. Also, it feels like the movie could have perhaps benefited from a slightly shorter running time, by about 10 minutes or so. Still, these are very minor complaints for a movie that is, by and large, one of the funniest I've seen.

When I saw this film, I was laughing harder than anybody in the entire theater. There were tears streaking down my face during some of the more outrageous gags, and even some of the not-so-funny stuff managed to elicit some strong chuckles. And at the end of the whole experience, right through the hilarious outtakes, none of it really made me feel bad for any of the bystanders involved (you'll get to see why during the credits), and I felt happy at the ultimate outcome for these two likable oafs of characters.

"Bad Grandpa" is not going to win any awards, but it is going to make you bust a gut and care about the characters, which is more than I can say for most comedies these days.

Grade: B

This movie was a lot funnier than I was expecting. Knoxville's Irving character is dirty, crude, and hilarously BAD! When his wife dies, Irving must take his grandson Billy on a road trip to get him to his whitetrash dad. Throughout the film, Irving and Billy prank people at strip clubs, convenient stores, restaurants, beauty pageants and much more. Jackson Nicoll who played Billy really has a lot of guts to dress up like a girl at a beauty pageant and do a pole-dance. If you love dark humor, you'll love JACKASS PRESENTS: BAD GRANDPA!!!

Bad Grandpa is a vulgar version of candid camera. It is very funny at times, somewhat funny at other times, but mostly obscene and crude. It starts at a hospital where Grandpa learns that his wife has just died. He is overjoyed. He says he has been badgered for many years by his wife and is now free. He claims that he hadn't had sex with her since 1990; I guess this means some twenty years. He says he is now free; which seems to mean that he can now go out and have sex. No explanation is given why he could not have had extramarital sex during the past decades. His attempts to have sex is often ridiculous and, as I said, crude. His daughter is incarcerated and he needs to care for his grandson, which sometimes adds to the humor.
The best parts of the film are the reactions of people to how he acts. It seems that the people watching are bystanders, not paid actors, a couple of them have their faces covered over, as if they did not give the producers the right to use their image.
While many people liked the film, I feel it is not worth one's time to watch.
Funny at times, not a good movie!!

Oh so crude but funny, offensive but endearing, crass but poignant, slimy but refreshing. Johnny Knoxville is so good as Bad Grandpa and Jackson Nicoll is so good as the grandson and their evolving relationship is rich. I love and admire the candid camera work where real people react genuinely to very awkward situations and the ensuing escalation of tensions and the edgy, unpredictable outcomes. Fun to watch but with some seedy and objectionable parts but tastefully, even lovingly done and never in my opinion ugly or degrading. Nice job.

As a long-time fan of Johnny Knoxville, I thought I was tired of him and that he had nothing new for me.  It took a friend to email me the trailer for 'Bad Grandpa' who said she had seen it and found it so hilarious.  We laugh at the same kind of stuff more or less.  I cracked up at the trailer and immediately watched the movie.  You know Johnny K always pushes the envelope as far as possible, and if I wasn't so ill right now I certainly would have been doubled over laughing practically thru the whole thing.  Johnny disguises himself as an old man who is taking his grandson to live with his no-good father.  All the people in all the places they drive thru don't know he's in disguise, so he and his 'grandson' are doing and saying these ridiculous things and people think it's all real.  Their reactions are as good as Knoxville and the boy are.  I could sit here and say this humor is below me and I didn't enjoy it.  But everything is so over-the-edge, so unexpected, it's just all one big laugh with hardly a break in between.  One of the funniest movies ever.

Crass comedy to some it impressed me as very impressive in that it integrated real people into the scenes and showed real Americans reacting to outrageous behavior of a crass obnoxious and pervy grandfather and his abandoned grandson (actors).  Everyone who was put on the spot, normal Americans working and living, passed the tolerance test with flying colors. There was most notably a scene at a beauty pageant for little girls in the south that was so wrong on so many levels and such an abomination on a spiritual level. These mothers showing their children off as if they were grown women with all the sexual innuendoes and the shock they had at seeing the little boy acting like a stripper was so strange. It was a reality check.

I loved almost every minute of this. I'd give it 4 stars normally but I think it is rated too low on Amazon. If the Jackass stuff is too raunchy or outrageous for you then I think this may be your cure. I have ALWAYS loved Jonze and Knoxville doing the old couple. I always thought it was one of the best parts of the Jackass series. And here we get an actually, somewhat, touching story played for laughs and heart with the old man as the centerpiece. No, it isn't going to win an Oscar for acting or directing, but in actuality Johnny does the film right and really does make this character his own. The kid is mostly fantastic, superb in the pageant scene, and the make-up artists were actually nominated for an Oscar. And they deserved it.

No other film is quite like this. Hidden cameras are used everywhere to provoke reactions, and the setups are all but maybe one or two thought out extremely well. In fact, there isn't too much you could do to make the movie better. A perfect film to see with your teenage kids or just by yourself. HILARIOUS.

Continuation of the "Jackass" movies, Erving set's off on his own, the only way that Johnny Knoxville can still prank people, as nobody ever watched any of the obnoxious Jackass films...LOL. Just fundamentally wrong, but so right and funny as hell, and the kid is great, a Steve-O in training. If you have an hour and half that you just don't want to think, but laugh, the movie to watch.

The lack of empathy for other human beings in this movie was too disturbing for my tastes.  I was never really a fan of Candid Camera or Punked style media, even if this one has a semblance of a plot.  It never gets as funny as the filmmakers think it is.  And really the makeup isn't that great either.  Academy Award nomination aside, this movie is forgettable and lazy.  There is no rigor applied to its making except for, perhaps, Johnny Knoxville's inventive self-destruction.  In that way, its a kind of performance art, but never satisfying, only depressing.

I have to give credit where it is due: this is a unique film.  They took the idea of Candid Camera (or Jackass) and put a plot behind it to string together all the pranks, making it a much better movie than Jackass.
To be fair, the only thing i find funny about Jackass (the shows and movies), is re-telling the scenes.  I don't think I have ever laughed while watching the scenes...and so Grandpa is no different to me.  I respect the creative attempt, and the writing of the pranks (they are funny on paper), but watching real people react to stupidity just doesnt make me laugh.

I laughed til I cried with Old School, Something About Mary, even American Pie, but pranks on ordinary people make me cringe...Punk'd occasionally made me smile tho.

I can't remember the last time anything made me laugh so hard. It's one of those things that's difficult to watch because it's awkward, embarrassing, and just plain WRONG on so many levels, but at the same time, so freakin' funny you can't stop, even though it may make you squirm a little. Some of the funniest scenes (the strip club and the diner especially) actually made me glad that I was watching alone. Pretty much the whole movie was one laugh after another, and the thing he had going throughout most of the first half with his dead wife was an absolute RIOT!

I am not much of a Jackass fan only because I don't like seeing them injure themselves, and some of their stunts look painful. That said, in this movie Johnny Knoxville is fantastic (as was his makeup), and a true genius. I had to keep reminding myself each time I began to marvel about how well he could run, dance, and jump around that he isn't actually an old man--LOL! He's really THAT convincing. The kid was great too. Normally I find mouthy kids to be obnoxious and avoid films that feature them, but this boy was SOOOO funny!

Definitely see it if you have a good sense of humor, are open minded, and don't buy into the idiocy that is "political correctness". If you're a fan of twisted, black comedy, this movie will not disappoint. If you're prudish, or can't comprehend why over-the-top, in-your-face, blatant, offensiveness IS funny, then this movie isn't for you. For the rest of us who see that there are far worse things in the world than "Bad Grandpa" and are happy and grateful for a reason to laugh--this movie is a treasure.

You wouldn't go to a transformers expecting requiem for a dream, why would you expect anything other than juvenile hilarity from the guys from jackass?

In short: the movie follows Knoxville (the grandpa) on a quest to return his grand son to his father after the child's mother (the grandpa's daughter) is sent to jail. The grandpa, recently free from the shackles of matrimony and wants to be rid of the kid as fast as possible so he can "chase some tail". But, along the way the two come to care for each other.

Extremely simple and cliche set up. Still, the simplicity works, instead of trying to be anything remarkable, it frames a series of absolutely ridiculous and largely disjointed events inside of this simple frame. Now for your cinema snobs out there that like to "tut tut" at linear movies while swirling your crystal glass filled with your own farts, there are actually two levels to this "ordinary vs insane" set up. The comedy of the movie barrows from the jackass franchise of crazy crap happening during every day situations. So really the "ordinary vs insane" motif works on two levels (oh snap!)

Anyway, the long and short of it is that the movie is funny the way watching a drunk baby is funny. Sure, it's wrong, silly, and disgusting but that's the point.

Also, the pageant at the end is FANTASTIC! It's funny to watch the faces of women be horrified with the overly adult and sexualized way the boy dances while covering the blue eye shadow painted eyes of their daughters wearing evening gowns.

This film is a huge step up for the Jackass guys. Along with the expected (yet still hilarious) over-the-top crude humor and sight gags, this movie has a surprising amount of real heart and warmth. The few actors in the film are all superb. I watched this film after my wife had gone to bed. I was afraid I was going to awaken her, I was laughing so loud. The next night, despite her reluctance (she, like most women, is not a Jackass or Three Stooges fan), I convinced her to watch it. She loved it, too (and I got to see it a second time --- still funny). So, even if you're not a Jackass fan, I'd still recommend checking this very funny movie out.

And stay for the credits and outtakes!

Do yourself a favor and watch something else. This movie is painful to have to sit through and not the kind of painful you think of after watching a jackass skit. If we had paid to see this movie in the theaters I would've probably considered requesting a refund. This movie is basically a toned down version of Jackass edited to have a plot.

Financially speaking this movie was a huge success earning more than 6 times what it cost to make, but from a movie go'ers perspective I will never get the two hours we wasted on the movie back and we're probably a little stupider for watching it.

Bottom line, you'll get a few laughs out of this movie as well as some shock and awe, but I don't think it's worth the pain of sitting through the whole flick. In my opinion you'll get more pleasure watching the first and last scenes of the movie than you will sitting through the whole thing.

As much as wed all love the Jackass movies to continue, the guys are getting older, and if you saw the last movie, its clear that a couple of them aren't exactly eager when it comes to dangerous stunts any more. Johnny Knoxville keeps the brands humor alive by playing an old man, something done in the show with great results, for a whole movie. When I first saw trailers for Bad Grandpa, I was worried that it might only be funny for a few minutes, then fizzle out. Instead, Bad Grandpa had me laughing out loud a couple of times, and it manages to deliver the same kind of humor and style that made Borat so great. I say that, but then you look at my 3 star rating. Why? Unfortunately, Bad Grandpa, while it has some genuinely funny segments (literally and figuratively), also falls flat a couple of times, enough to the point where I was itching to fast forward through the scene and move on to the next. Its still very much worth your time if you're a fan of Knoxville and his friends antics.

Irving Zisman is an old man who isn't exactly a model citizen. Hes rude, constantly complains about his wife, and his old age gets in the way of everyday activities. He also has a lot of pent up energy, as shown early on when he gets his genitals stuck in a vending machine outside of a convenience store. Irving ends up taking care of his grandson, Billy, after the boys mom gets in some legal trouble. The old man isn't happy about this one bit, and immediately sets out to get Billy together with his dad, who isn't any better than Irving or Billys mom. The two go on a long road trip to take care of everything, and in the process, the trip also has them finding a spot to bury grandma after she passes away. There are a lot of stops on the way, with Irving using the young kid to help him attempt to get women, shoplift and much more.

If you ever saw the Jackass skits with the old people, thats exactly what the majority of this movie is. Its shot in a documentary style similar to Borat, with all kinds of camera angles to pick up the best of every scene. The duo go to a good variety of places to get reactions from people, from adult shops to a diner parking lot to a male strip club. Knoxville does a great job with the character of Irving, going all out and doing whatever it takes to get the most laughs out of whatever hes doing. The boy who plays Billy is great too, and reminds me a lot of The Kid from Bad Santa in that he plays the part pretty straight and never freaks out about what his grandpa is doing. There are even some kind of touching scenes where he talks to complete strangers about his parents, asking some guys if theyll be his new dad because he doesnt really have one. Youd think that something like this might break the film up and have the laughs come to a screeching halt, but they dont. Things tend to pick up with the laughs very quickly here. Some of my favorite gags included Irving dealing with a tough guy after breaking a restaurants mascot statue and the films climax involving a certain kind of beauty/talent contest.

I watched the unrated version, which was a little longer than the original cut, so maybe they just cut too much back into the movie, but some scenes went on for too long. Usually, they were the ones that didn't get any laughs out of me or I felt could have been better. The beginning and end of Bad Grandpa are hilarious, while the middle had me wondering when something good was going to happen. What may turn a lot of people off though, is how disgusting some of the humor is. I hate to bring it up again, but if something like Borat offends you, you should stay away from Bad Grandpa. Its not as bad but it is very similar. This is the old people skits from Jackass turned up a few notches.

Bad Grandpa is sure to make a lot of people laugh, provided they're used to the likes of Johnny Knoxville and pals. Casual viewers may abandon ship within the first 20 minutes. Even then, you should try to stick through the whole thing because the payoff near the end is absolutely worth it. When you're making real people on camera cry because of what you did, you've struck gold.

I used to love watching the old Jackass movies as cut-scene after cut-scene were dumb, obscene, disgusting, and mostly violent pranks, jokes, and dares. Of course, that was when I was in my late college years when Knoxville first showed up on MTV. This was more of a move-like adaptation of the old nastiness tied up in a story of a single mother who tries to pawn her son off to 'bad grandpa' (Knoxville). Of course, she does this aggressively during the funeral of Knoxville's wife, so you can imagine that her carcass will hit the floor sooner or later. The son's father is only interested in the boy when he finds out he can receive a $600 stipend. Knoxville and the son go on a road trip and scene after scene of uncomfortable interactions take place.

Hard to explain, it's like an actual movie with lines and roles but done jackass style, there are only three or for characters in the movie and they stay in character throughout til the very end which is cool its like an actual movie except for the fact the most of the other people in it are just people who have no idea a movie is being shot until the scene is finished as it shows during the credits, i really like that duality of it. It's not just johnny knoxville and some kid messing with people(even though it actually is but at the same time it isn't) it's an old man and his grandson and a couple others who are "characters in a movie" whilst the rest are just regular people who have no idea a movie is being made. Idk you just have to see it for yourself! Seriously, check it out!! Its like something that's never been done before yet it has at the same time just one way(movie) or the other(pranks, jackass) but this is both at once... you'll see what i mean when you watch it-4 stars!!!

Johnny Knoxville's Bad Grandpa is under rated. Sure, it is rough, crude and hard to watch some parts, but I got the crazy can't stop laughing fits in several parts watching it home alone, I can imagine it would be even funnier in a movie theatre full of laughing people. Most Hollywood movies are so lame nowadays and predictable,  I honestly was not expecting much, Knoxville and the kid delivered. The theme is sort of like Borat, but I found this movie to be funnier and the characters much more likeable..
I also found the concern and compassion of many of the people who were fooled by Grandpas behavior very comforting.
I think Peter Jackson, Mel Gibson and Johnny Knoxville are the only people left in Hollywood  making movies that I want to see more than once.

Johnny Knoxville hidden under an ace special make up effects job, portrays 86- year-old Irving Zisman who takes a trip from Nebraska to North Carolina to take his 8 year-old grandson, Billy,Jackson Nicoll back to his real father, along the way the pair set up some clever hidden camera stunts where the unsuspecting members of the public are unwittingly fooled by the pair via vulgar set ups. in all honesty there are a handful of belly laughs to be had, but the concept really should of followed the previous 'Jackass' outings by setting up hidden camera and doing skits/prat falls whereas the 'dramatic' story line is merely 'filler' to extend the running time amid a poor montage of skits, the Old people gone amok sch-tick was better suited in the previous instalment's.

Moving in another direction for their fourth film, the producers of Jackass decided to focus on a single character from the franchise, Johnny Knoxville's Irving Zisman. The film has everything you've come to expect from the series, as Knoxville plays a Grandfather, on vacation with his Grandson. Knoxville does his usual schtick, crashing into to things, saying outrageous things to strangers, and of course showing off his giant rubber testicles. As with most of the Jackass stuff, it's outrageous and hilarious for the first half hour, but quickly gets old. Maybe I'm just too old to appreciate Jackass anymore, but when I start out watching one of their films, I love it, and by the end, I'm just waiting for it to be over with. Knoxville is impressive, and while he's done films on his own, I think he was giving a message to the rest of the group in this film. The message being, if you guys don't want to do this anymore, I can make it work with anyone, even a 10 year old kid. Hopefully the message gets through and we'll get some more Jackass films. I really do love the simplistic comedic genius of the films, but it's repetitive nature makes anything more than an episode of the show wear on me. Maybe it's just not made for someone in my age group anymore, but regardless of age, Jackass has always been good for a few laughs and Bad Grandpa is no exception.

I saw this in the movies and have to admit I didn't laugh the first time around. The reason being my mouth was hanging open at Grandpa's antics. I knew that the movie was filmed a la Candid Camera and he was pulling these stunts on unsuspecting people! I don't know how he got away with it. But after the shock was gone, I kept thinking of it and kept laughing. Everything he does is funny but the nightclub scene where the men strip for the ladies...again, I was in shock the first time but have been laughing out loud every time I think of it since then. This is why I bought this movie. The young boy is incredible. To know that he's pulling off this fake stuff with a straight face...I'm sure we'll be seeing more of him! The only thing I would suggest is do not treat it as family night. Watch the movie before you let your children see it. There may be some scenes you don't want them to see...like the nightclub! Get the popcorn and settle in for some great laughs. It all gets explained at the end.

There's no denying Johnny Knoxville's  Irving Zisman  was the highlight of "Jackass 2".  He was funny, ribald, and fresh.  That said giving the old geezer his own vehicle stretches the limits of the character.  There's just not enough material to sustain feature length.  There is no arguing that the film has its moments.  Best bits include Irving making he and his grandson a sandwich at the supermarket and Old Irv dropping into ladies night at an African-American burlesque club.  Probably would have worked better as a one-off special on MTV.  If anything the film does answer the question as to whether fish have genitalia.

And now for something completely different.  If you think, like most,  this is simply an overused clich, especially within comedies, then stop here.  This isn't something you're open to.  If, on the other hand, you are open-minded and seek a different flavor of comedy then you're in luck.

As many know, the MTV show Jackass celebrated outrageously bad behavior wrapped in the guise of mind-numbing stupid, and many times dangerous, stunts.  The bent mind behind that, of course, was one Johnny Knoxville.  That show was best consumed in small servings as it tested the bounds of taste.  The show ran its course, but Knoxville didn't fade into the night.  Its been a while since the show and the cash-in movie.  So, the time could be right for a revival of sorts.

While jumping off of Jackass, Bad Grandpa is a very different animal.  Its a fictitious story even as it intersperses some almost stunt-like vignettes as the story unfolds.  The bad taste is wholly intact.  The question of just how much the, supposedly uninformed, normal people appearing really know looms large.  It really doesnt matter if they're wholly in or not because they seem clueless for the most part and act accordingly.  Its funny and works.

I don't know how much of it was scripted (I'm sure much of it was), but it couldn't have all been scripted because he had to react to other people's reactions on the fly. I do have to say that if you are offended by 5th grade boy humor or you don't find farts and balls funny, you probably won't care for this movie. Then again, if you don't find farts or balls funny, you're probably a stick in the mud anyway. I rarely ever buy DVDs. Ever. As SOON as we were done watching this on Pay-Per-View, I hopped on Amazon and ordered it. It's now edged out Bridesmaids, The Hangover, and Hot Tub Time Machine as the funniest movie I've ever seen.

Writer, star and original jackass Johnny Knoxville eschews his normal companions and their plot-less hijinks for a boy and a journey.  The story is simple.  Irving Zisman (Knoxville), an 86 year old recently widowed (co-writer Spike Jonze) grandfather.  At the funeral, Irving's daughter (Georgina Cates) drops off her 8 year old son, Billy (a game Jackson Nicoll) on her way to prison where she'll spend the next 6 months.  Irving is going to deliver Billy to the boy's bumpkin dad (Greg Harris) several hundred miles away in South Carolina.  The trip is a hoot.

Along the way Irving and Billy engage a bar filled with black male strippers, a couple of FedEx/UPS type clerks unwilling to ship Billy in a carton, funeral home mourners and sympathetic bikers in a bar.  All this while transporting his wife's body (Jonze) in the trunk of a Lincoln coupe.  It's a Lincoln even if the steering wheel said Ford.  Perhaps the funniest, if unoriginal, scene comes when Irving enters Billy in one of those repulsive beauty pageants designed for young girls.

It would appear that throughout the movie, only a few actors were in on the shenanigans and the real fun comes as the bystanders react.  It's priceless.  This couldn't have been pulled off without the Oscar nominated (not kidding) make up work of Stephen Prouty and some great comedic performances by Knoxville and young Nicoll.  The Jeff Tremaine directed movie isn't for everyone as there are plenty of jokes involving bodily functions and the nether regions but I was laughing throughout the picture.

The Blu ray disc comes in 1080P with a 1.78:1 aspect ratio.  Don't expect eye popping HD here as many of the scenes are shot with well hidden small cameras.  Still it's all watchable and as good as to be expected.  Much like the video, the DTS-HD Master Audio 5.1 track is about as good as it can be.  Hidden mics, some distant, occasionally have a difficult time picking up nuances.  I have no complaints.  Subtitles are available in English SDH, French, Spanish and Portuguese.  Extras include several behind-the-scene shorts, alternative takes, deleted scenes, a DVD and a digital copy.  Several outtakes and the reaction of the unknowing participants, after being told what was going on, run during the closing credits.

This movie is so dumb, and it is absolutely hysterical. The setup, premise and humor are all as simple as its title implies, but what the movie does it does so well. The entire affair becomes a little more intelligent from the sociological experiment of guessing and seeing how different people react to these offenses. While the story is somewhat negligible to the main attraction of the gags, the filmmakers and cast still do a decent job of injecting some heart into the proceedings. Similar more to the prank comedy on unsuspecting marks like "Borat" more than the physical punishment of "Jackass," there are numerous points that will leave the viewer crying with laughter.

I might be in my 30's but still a touching scene hit home in my heart.  But as for myself the scene that made me laugh the strongest was (spoiler) the talent show to find a girl to be a new princess and grandson posing as a girl to win the contest.  Still overall a great movie for laughs, touching moments between family memebers, and proves Johnny Knoxville can hit homerun with the laughs and at times be a serious actor in some of the scenes.

Really did not like bad grandpa.  Looked like they sat down and decided all the awful things that they could throw in one movie about the relationship of a kid and his grandpa.  Really thought it was in bad taste.

The premise is really very clever ... there's an actual story and the filmmakers used actual people in crazy situations.  The looks on their faces are so classic and so funny ... but the language, teaching the kid to drink beer, "Sharting" up a wall in a restaurant ... yuck.  Can't say I recommend those parts of the movie.  Of course, what else would you expect from the "Jackass" people.  It's 12 year old boy toilet humor elevated to grownup art.  Even though parts of it are revolting, overall, it's absolutely hilarious.  When Grandpa mows down the Penguin in front of a diner/convenience store and the owner comes out to fight with him, I was crying I was laughing so hard.  Who hasn't had a Grandpa who could get into a pickle like that?  The Bingo hall part was also off the charts funny.  There are some really genuinely funny people in this world, and these guys found a whole bunch of 'em to bounce their craziness off.  Not for everyone, but if you can stand this kind of humor, it's a riot.
This movie was actually funnier than I thought.  Knoxville was hilarious as Irving and his sidekick/grandson, Billy are a great duo.

The story line is loose and really just is there to give premise for the gags, but the gags and stunts and stuff were HILARIOUS. This movie had me laughing out loud many times. Well worth the $5 Amazon rental fee.
it was funny from start to end. the little boy was very funny and story line was was cool. I recommend this movie to any one who likes Jack Ass and Johnny Knox
Hilarious!!!!! I laughed so hard I was crying.  It was so inappropriate which made it that much more humorous. A must see!!!

I found 3 scenes that were funny enough to bring tears to my eyes from laughter.
worth watching thank you
I did not finish this movie as I thought it was terrible to have the bad language and behavior that the main character put out there.  So rude.

I don't know anyone who would honestly say that any film in the Jackass franchise is "the best film".  At least while sober and lucid.

That having been said, this film is fun with some great scenes that you will find yourself laughing in spite of your higher sensibilities.  Being from NC, I like the numerous scenes of my hometown and home state.  I can actually see the reactions of the supporting characters really happening.  In fact, the biker group who stepped up to defend the boy is a real group in the town where the scene was filmed.  That's what makes the Jackass franchise good - it is reality film on ludicrous steroids!

Watch it if you've had a crummy day or week.  With a drink.  Or ten.  Then report to the Politically Correct re-education camp the next day!  :)
It is hilarious but like I think most people expected it doesn't have a great plot line. I would watch it again.
Good and very funny ... Plus that make up work looks so real.. Blah blah blah and also blah blah
loved it.  It made me laugh out loud from beginning to end.  Johnny Knoxville is great as grandpa and the young boy is excellent
Movie had its funny points but i really expected more. I could have just watched the previews as all the really funny parts were there.
The fact that this film was shot on location and the unsuspecting  "cast" involved makes it hilarious. A bit raunchy and certainly adults only entertainment but very funny.
Funny ass movie.made me laugh laugh my ass off. Johnny K is one crazy ass white boy. Still laughing at this one
Some things went too far!  Yuck!!!!!!  I would never recommend to anyone.  Distasteful. Nasty. Too ridiculous to be funny in a lot of instances.
This is funny, just plain funny.  Great movie. We rented it then bought this one because we just had to watch it again.
Kind of slow in the beginning but it might seem that way because I am used to other Jackass films. There are plenty of laughs in this one as well.

I laughed nearly to tears a couple of times.  The story and content are mostly what you would expect from "dickhouse productions."  Rather than being a near-constant gross-out fest in the vein of other Jackass flicks, this story has a loose plot, and derives its funniest moments from the reactions of innocent bystanders.  Think Candid Camera, Borat, and Jackass rolled into one.  As you might predict, not necessarily one you would enjoy as much with your parents in the same room.
Johnny Knoxville is so funny in this show; he is so crazy....Bad Grandpa is funny; but has a serious ending; a grandpa's love for his grandson...Watch it...

When I went to see this at the theaters, I didn't have any money to buy popcorn or refreshments. I'm very glad I didn't, otherwise I would of thrown up. This movie I find totally sick, disgusting, above all else inappropriate for children. No wonder it was rated R in the theaters. The sexual enuendo, the inappropriate adult dialogue spoken in some scenes by the little boy and so much more. I always thought John Hughes was the king of having young children use adult dialogue in films. These people beat his act in a second, I think. Thanks to this movie, I refuse to ever go see another comedy film again no matter how much it's being talked about. Steven Spielberg's directed comedy before; or at least produced. Why couldn't he have done this? It would of been at least a million times better than these stupid so-called filmmakers. BAD GRANDPA is a disgrace!
This movie is crass, not very funny, and a waste of money.  Not in good taste.  Don't bother renting it.
Great movie, will watch again!! The pranks they pull on people are jaw dropping and keep you laughing all the way through the movie.
This movie was just too funny, I almost hurt myself laughing. When you figure in the fact these are real stunts pulled on people that don't know what's going on.
This movie was sort of funny if you are bored. A few moments were Knoxville-esque but overall a waste of time and money. Recommend re-watching a funny movie that you already know will make you laugh.
Worst movie was Anchorman. Both got turned off about 30 - 40 minutes in. If you like raunchy humor without a real story line, this movie is for you. I was taken in by the 3.7/5 star rating.
what a great movie.  I thought they did a great job and was laughing pretty much the whole time! I highly recommend for a great laugh!
Movie is an lousy. Tries to be funny but is not. My recommendation is do not waste your time or money on this

I loved this movie. Every scene was a keeper and just incredibly funny. (I've told my family that after I die I want them to do exactly what bad grandpa did in this movie. If you don't watch any of the rest of the movie, see that one scene - just laugh out loud funny!) I'm a huge Jackass fan and they really did a great one this time - knocked it out of the park on the hilarity scale. The kid in this movie should win an Oscar.
Worst movie I have ever seen.  Only watched for 5 minutes and turned off.  Stupid and disgusting  would recommend not spending your money on this movie

I am not a devotee of the Jackass franchise but wanted to watch this because a funny trailer convinced me and my 11 year old. Thanks for the deceptive marketing. It's incredible how little effort was put into something that we're expected to pay for like it is a real movie. Johnny Knoxville is totally unbelievable as an 87 year old grandfather of an around 8 year old (wait, didn't we skip a generation?)

The production values are so shoddy that in many scenes they have subtitles because the sound is unintelligible. I kid you not.
Because Johnny Knoxville is just an all around funny human being and he did good in all of his other movies espically the popcorn sutton interview on YouTube
This was OK, not great, not terrible.  It had its few moments, but fell short of the "Jackass" humor you might be expecting.
I think it's by far one of the funniest movies since stepbrothers which was also funny if you like to laugh this is your movie

This movie was recommended to me by a friend.  I watched the first fifteen minutes and asked myself why on earth I bought it.  From there I skipped forward to see if any of it was worth my time.  Another fifteen minutes and it was ejected from the player.  This is, without any doubt, one of the top three worst movies I have ever tried to watch. It was quickly deposited in the trash.

I was not a fan of Jack Ass I did watch them and maybe some funny parts but it wasn't for me. However with out the background of those other shows I would not have been able to understand what was going on here. The story is great and I couldn't stop my self from laughing and the worse part was I was in a moral when I saw it late at night so I didn't want to disturb others.
disgusting and inappropriate.  Very disappointed.  Thought it was going to be funny but was trashy. did not even finish it
Terrible movie. Not what expected. Movie has a lot of adult content. Only watched half of it and couldn't watch anymore
Whose the parents of that kid? But Johnny Knoxville is a real American hero, although I'm not sure if that's a good thing.

If you don't like Johnny Knoxville and his over the top pranks, then you might not like this. However if you want over the top ridiculousness, vulgarity, and awe inspiring public displays of idiocy at its finest, then you will love this. Bad Grandpa changes it up and tries to add a story in with the madness. Its a nice touch, and works well however could have been improved upon like anything else in the movie industry. The real attraction is the pranks, and I don't want to ruin it, but every scene will give you a good chuckle.
Lowest humor possible. Couldn't finish it. People are made to look like complete idiots and there really is no story line to speak of.

I was not interested in seeing this based on the previews but my wife surprisingly suggested it one night and since that was so out of character I jumped on the chance to enjoy some juvenile laughs instead of some Victorian/Jane Austen crap.

The premise is pretty clever. Sort of a cross between Jackass, Borat, Punked and ABC's What Would You Do? I have to admit, I was crying laughing at times. Had to pause several times just to recover and make sure I didn't miss anything. Some bits are relentlessly funny.

Definitely worth a watch.
Bad Grandp was a bad movie. It was not worth waching it, and forget paying for it. It was not even funny.
If you enjoy jackass type humor you will find this very enjoyable. While their is a story it's not very laid out and it's just like a new kind of jackass movie with a back story
I haven't laughed that hard in ages! I watched it with my teenagers and we all enjoyed it. Johnny Knoxville is great!
It was a stupid movie, risque, insulting; indecent; just the kind of movie you should expect if you buy: After all, it is Johnny Knox.
Horrible movie. Could barely watch the 1st 20 min. before I turned it off. Wasted money for sure. Don't bother.
I DONT CARE FOR JACKASS BUT I DID LIKE THIS MOVIE IT WAS GOOD AND FUNNY AND THE BIKERS TO PROTECT KIDS

I thought this movie was going to be in the tradition of the other Jack-ass movies. Sadly disappointed. I only chuckled twice during this film. One was the preview scene of grandpa being shot through the window in the coin operated ride. The other was when he and the grandson were in a restaurant and had a f--t contest. I may have snickered at a couple of other scenes, but very few. Lot of cussing, but no nudity, unless you would consider those fake mountain oysters seen in other Jack-ass films nudity. Basically the movie is about grandpa getting rid of his dear wifes body after she died. Packs the body in the back of his car and drives it across the country to take his grandson back to his father on the east coast, who's a loser with a bikers gang. After dropping off the grandson with his dad, he goes back and gets him and have more zany experiences together including a beauty contest the grandson enters as a girl. They eventually end up dumping grandmas body in a river,( her last wish). Some people may really enjoy this film, but not me. I should have saved the money. If I can, I'll trade it in.
We loved this movie and instant Amazon on our smart TV is just amazing. This movie is halarious and the live stream was flawless/.
If you're looking for a movie with grade school jokes, this is the movie for you. A real exercise in stupidity.
While the movie had a couple of laughs for the most part it was very hard to watch.  I would not recommend this movie to my friends.
Would not watch this again. Stupid , was not funny, no story line, watch something else no value for your dollar

This was a very low budget film. Don't get me wrong parts of this movie were hilarious, but I wouldn't have wasted my money to see it had I known the whole movie was about the grandpa trying to get laid. It's more of a movie for an older teenager or young adult. Not a very good date night movie.
If you've seen anything from the Jackass crew you know it's gonna be great. This movie was funny but not funny enough for 5 stars. I'd recommend watching it but not buying it.
I am not a fan of jackass films but my husband loves them. This was a bit diferent than the others and yes it was funny. At least it didn't make me want to turn it off.
This isn't the best movie in the world. I think Johnny could have made this movie more exciting. This movie had way to many boring parts.

Don't kid yourself! Johnny Knoxville... there's probably some who would be offended by this, but I found it to be funny and charming. There are definitely scenes that would be deemed "inappropriate" by some viewers, so beware if you are looking for smart humor or a brilliant storyline.

One of the worst movies I've bought. (It's already been put on e-bay). It's like the entire movie was shot on a cell phone video; "jumpy images." This had to have been made by a bunch of drunk college kids, as it's nothing but short "clips" of "so called comedy" put together with duct tape. Don't waste your money.
Not a great movie. It shifted between jackass and a not well thought out film. I really expected more out of this team.
TERRIBLE, I CANT BELIEVE THE PEOPLE INVOLVED IN THIS GOT PAID.  SEND THEM ALL TO THE EDD OFFICE,  I WANT MY MONEY BACK.........

This movie is funny, but not hilarious, it seem too much like a cheap homemade movie than a professional one.
Parts were humorous but movie lacked quality.  B type movie as characters and plot were more random and shallow. Thumbs down
Deffinately not a kids movie! Very awesome movie, not a dry eye while watching it from laughing so hard.  And the little boy is absolutely adorable!!
I thought it was okay, my husband thought it was great......surprise..........it's a man thing.  It is worth watching though.  Some laughs.
i want my money back.  Rude. No appropriate for any age - language, scene, Gave it till 1/2 way and then had to forfeit.
if you liked borat youll probably like this movie... if you liked jackass youll probably like this movie... if you liked niether you will hate this movie....

This film definitely had it's funny moments, but is not something you could watch with young kids!
Johnny Knoxville uses his crude behavior coupled with his typical comedy in which he shares the reactions from ordinary people, that do not know they are in a movie!
Knoxvilles best performance as an actor. When I get old this is exactly how I would be as an old man lol.
I ordered this I saw the previews and ordered it and got to watch it on my time and it ws good but once again without the kindle I wouldn't of enjoyed it as much

This wasn't as outrageously  funny as I thought it would be, but when you get to some of the scenes............OMG..........I burst out laughing so hard.  I think it is well worth buying a watching over and over.
Very Funny Movie. Best Comedy in a long time! It is a must see movie for anyone who likes comedies!
If you liked jackass then, you will like bad grandpa. Johnny Knoxville performance is very funny the cimisty between the two main actors is classic funny.
love this movie and the FX in it in  HD it was worth the money fast shipping

Really great acting out of Johnny Knoxville, and the little boy. The jokes were fresh and it felt like I was part of the audience. Every scene was different and unexpected. I strongly suggest beyond the video.
Turned if off after 15 minutes.  I should get a refund.  I can not think of another movie that is as bad as this
I had no idea what to expect from this movie, but it actually had a storyline like a regular movie compared to something from jackass.
This is not funny for me.  I thought most of it was not good humor. I would not want to see it again.
Looking for a movie that doesn't make you think but makes you laugh the entire time. This is it. Hilarious

Bad grandpa is really a waste of flim. The  acting is awful the things that were done in this should never be and said around children. I really loveva good comedy but this really bad done waste your time and money to watch this piece of crap!!
Could not stop laughing. To the reaction on faces if normal people was awesome.  The storyline in the movie was also good.

The concept of taking the besst elements of Jackass and combining them with an actual story (as light as that story may be) was pretty brilliant. Getting those visceral reactions from people who had no idea they were being filmed was pretty awesome...and of course hilarious. I laughed pretty much all the way through the movie,and just when you think it couldn't get any more over the top, they prove you wrong, lol. Knoxville was in top form for this and the kid was actually pretty amazing. He pulled off some stuff straight faced that most adults would never be able to do. I highly recommend this. Maybe don't let your kids watch it though. ;)
Hillarious movie with lots of funny awkward moments with the typical "jackass" style stunts mixed in. This is a must watch.
The previews were better, but the film was a great watch.  I'm not a big fan of jackass but the main movie, and this movie, are a lot of fun.
we enjoyed this movie so much, soooo funny and we defiantly think it's worth watching. we've watched it a few times and we still think it's funny.
It was awesome and I mean it had us laugh our a s s off lol totally watch it I agree it will never get old !!!!!!

If you don't like the Jackass movies, you won't like this. But after watching the amount of behind the scenes work they go through is amazing. The extras on the disc are worth it alone. The reveal to the marks are worth their weight in gold!

I saw this in the theater when it came out. The entire audience was on the floor laughing throughout the entire movie.

If you take your comedy seriously, you won't like this. If you want to be entertained for 90 minutes (Plus a lot of deleted scenes and behind the scenes  extras) then you need to buy this!
this was the funniest movie i have ever seen, very inopropriat, not for young children. so yeah, it was good.
This was by far the worst movie ever.  I was not even funny.  It was actually stupid and  not worth the cost of what we paid to watch it.

Not for teens or parents who do not approve of swearing, crudeness or lack of civility.  The only interesting thing about this movie is that the scenes are done with unsuspecting people in real life situations.  Funny at times, but not my cup of tea.

Hands down the worst movie I've seen, possibly ever.  I shut it off 40 minutes into it and went to bed.  Bad acting, pretty lame jokes.  The movie trailer will give you all the 1/2 decent scenes, don't get suckered into it.
I haven't laughed that hard in a very, very long time! If you are in the mood to laugh make sure that you get this movie!!!
all the funny stuff was showed on the previews It would have been better to just show gags instead of tryin to make a lame movie out of it
Funny and entertaining. It's a great movie to watch with friends. It might be too graphic for kids. Johny Knoxville's makeup looked amazing.

i can tell you  there were some funny parts. but most of the time i felt really uncomfortable. child neglect and abuse i do not find funny. i do say watch it once if you really want to. but once i guarantee is all you will need. trust me.
Simply amazing it was funny entertaining still has the same things you'd expect from the guys from jackass loved it
Love it very much, was crying laughing. Knoxville is a genius!!  Watched OVER and OVER.  Knoxville, PLEASE do another one!!!
If you like this kind of comedy you will find it over the top funny!!! My husband found it entertaining, I myself found it mildly amusing .. The pageant scene was hilarious ...

I won't go into a long review, because I'm sure there are plenty of those. For Jackass fans; prepare for a movie that is slow, toned down, and in which you don't get the see the reaction of people realizing this is a prank until the end. The format is that of an actual movie, not a series of pranks. What made this movie unappealing to me was the music. It was really dreary. Had they chosen different music, the pranks would have seemed funnier. But having really sad music over the scenes, made them seems like scenes from a crappy tragedy instead of a comedy. I did laugh a handful of times, but I think at that point I was desperately trying to enjoy myself. It's good acting, but just an odd combination of Jackass humor mixed with a somber plot. Wouldn't buy. Rent if you're bored and okay with staying bored.
This is supposed to be a movie.  It tells a story however there is no plot and not very funny.  Got through twenty minutes and had to turn it off cause it was so boring.
I am a liberal in many ways but if I had to not stand for something wrong it would be this movie.
This has to be one of the funniest movies I've seen in awhile, not children appropriate, but get your adult friends over for a movie night of laughter!!!
This movie is hilarious. It's silly, it's clever. I laughed until the end. Great movie. I would buy this for my collection.

Yes,Knoxville bulled out another out the rear performance. My thirteen year loved it. It may be a little strong for some people's taste, so take caution if you kids are going to watch it. It not called jackass for nothing. Lol
IF you liked jackass, then you will like this. I recommend the un cut version. More fun .. Closed captioning was out of sync though.

Intricate movie. Filmed with a story but all the scenes have random people in them that don't know they are in a movie. Very funny, but really inappropriate. I give it 5 stars cause it's unique the way they filmed it. It's a work of art.
I like Johnny Knoxville... but 15 minutes into this piece of crap and can't believe I just spent money for this. Disregard all the 4 & 5 star reviews and skip this one.
still has the tasteless humor that the Jackass crew enjoying displaying but definitely has its moments. it is worth multiple viewing.
this whole thing looked set up. all the best parts were in the commercial. i love the idea but it wasn't executed properly
Come on guys. This kind of humor is old hat, move on and grow up! My grandson didn't even think it was funny and he's a teenager!

I have two teenage boys, and we've watched every Jackass movie made. So, no stranger to this Knoxville character, I was still impressed with this movie, they took the character well beyond anything Jackass has ever done before. The movie really had it all. The kid was so cute, and played his part extremely well. There was comedy and touching moments. I liked the blend of movie parts, and all the parts that were skits played out in the real world. The end, where you get to see how the people reacted to finding out the characters were actors was just as funny. A genius idea that was well executed.

More than a handful of people told me this movie was hilarious.  It is not.  In fact, it's borderline terrible.  You're better off watching a handful of prank videos on you tube.  This movie has a great premise, but fails to deliver.
I Was Amusing, But Not Jackass Funny.  Don't Choose The Hd Version Because You Won't Be Able To See The Difference.
it was funny and didn't go to far like all the other movies did...their was a story line and a heart warming ending... best movie they made in a long time.
This was a very funny movie! Love Johnnie Knoxville he is funny and so was the little kid! So funny
It was a good laugh on a Saturday night!  Better than expected. Will most likely buy the DVD to have when you just need a good laugh.
Too Dog gone funny- This is not for the young ones though, It is full of all the things that a Bad Grandpa would do and of course from the Jack Ass group what else would you expect!
Even being fond of Mel Brooks, can't get into the Jackass style humor. However, that being said, if you ARE a fan of Jackass style humor I'm thinking this is a 5 star.

This is quite a funny film about a Grandpa who has to take his 8-year old grandson on a journey from Nebraska to North Carolina to return him to his father.  Like other Jackass movies, Grandpa (Knoxville) and the grandson set up elaborate pranks and jokes on the unsuspecting public.  Hilarious at times, the plot gives the movie a lot more cohesion than the Jackass films, and you end up rooting for the pair by the end.

As is the case with a lot of MTV movies, the funniest parts are in the commercials. The movie did have some good laughs and the story was somewhat touching but I wouldn't expect too much from this film.

The movie is fine for few minutes initially then it becomes monotonous with concept of comedy being overturned. I have watched Hangover I, II and III. The second and third parts almost had similar concept to the first one but the flow of story was different in each one and the  humor was blended well in to the story. This one has failed to blend the humor in the story instead the tries to force humor which actually sounds cheap.

Since I had not seen other Jackass movie I wasn't prepared for the way this movie started out. Did they really need to show grandpa's penis? (or fake penis) It could have been a kind of cute movie without the gross parts. Of course we hope that any man that teaches his 8-yr old grandkid to hustle and do other nasty things like in this movie should be charged with child abuse but this is a movie not real life.  I would have loved to see it end that way!
very very funny, not recommended for children, actually had to laugh out loud, funniest movie I've seen in a long time

This is no doubt the worst movie I tried to watch! If the "stars" went to the minus side, I would give it a minus 5! The trailer did not indicate how terrible this movie is. I did not watch the movie more that ten minutes before I shut it off. Amazon, is it possible to get a credit for not watching this trash?  Very bad, an insult to comedy.
Almost took a heart attack laughing!!!  It has it's weaker moments, but overall a good ninety minutes of belly laughs!

Like so many movies in the comedy genre, this one put all the best laughs into the trailers and commercials, which I saw so frequently that once I saw them in the movie they were no longer funny. What was left was more uncomfortable than funny. I actually fell asleep about 2/3 through which is saying a lot because I almost never fall asleep during a movie. Would give fewer stars but I think die-hard Jackass fans will still enjoy some of it, though I found the Jackass movies to be more entertaining.
Hilarious raunchy and downright good movie but it is not for children.  I was laughing the entire time, its one long prank with a plot.
I love Johnny Knoxville and all of the Jackass movies, but this one didn't deliver like I wanted it to.
Really bad movie. Raunchy bad humor, not suitable for any age group. What a waste of time. It insults your intelligence.
It felt like they were trying too hard.  Why bother with the story at all?  I'd rather do the dishes than continue watching this.  In fact, I am.

Ok, I'm not a jackass fan. Matter of fact, I think those movies are really dumb & can't imagine anyone paying to see them. However, when I saw a trailer for Bad Grandpa I thought I could possibly be converted - and I was.

Not only is the 'grandpa' character hilarious in this movie, but the kid....the kid is unbelievable & I don't think they would've had much of a movie without him. He keeps a straight face throughout the entire movie, even through his grandpas crazy stunts & insults. I don't know how he did it.

The funniest scene in this movie is **SPOILER ALERT** when the kid dresses up & enters in a children's pageant as a girl. He starts his dance routine all simple & cute a la 'good ship lollypop', then the song changes into 'Cherry Pie' and he rips off his dress, exposing his lingerie, and thrusting on the ground like a stripper. The looks on the pageant mom's faces in the audience is classic....apparently, it's ok to dress your child like a whore, but not ok if the child dances around on the stage like one. There are other funny scenes, but this one is so classic & funny that I actually went back & watched the scene again. Unreal. I bet the cameramen were having a field day shooting that scene!

The credits are also funny to watch, as they go through how they told people they were shooting a movie (after-the-fact, of course). Overall, I thought the movie was genius, even though I'm not a jackass fan. If you've got an hour-and-a-half to kill - rent it, it will make you laugh.
I dare you to not laugh through this movie.  The end is perhaps one of the funniest movie scenes ever.  Even if you don't care for Jackass antics, this is a great film!
Disgusting, sorry I rented it, had to turn it off after 20 minutes.  Wish I could get my rental fee and my time back.  Can you do negative Stars as a rating?
Thought it was going to be entertaining , instead it was boring and crude . Worst film ever rented on amazon,had to turn it off couldn't bear to watch the end.

At 36, this is so funny. However, my dad at 65, thought it was stupid. So don't recommend it for people who are seniors. Everybody else this is so funny. These are jokes commited on real people so their responces are geniune.
Laughed my ass off. Saw it twice. I was in tears. Bedroom scene the best. We need more jackass movies

One of the funniest movies I have ever seen. Of course its crude, rude, and socially unacceptable, which is why it is so FN funny. But what would you expect from former Jackass star Johnny Knoxville?

Exactly!
it has funny parts but all in all, its not a very good movie.  I thought it would have stupid parts which would actually make it somewhat funny, but its a stupid, jackass of a movie.
Another Jackass mvie but this the best ever,I was laughin since the beginin. I don't see a real funny movie like this in a long time.lately is only this one. Great.
thought it was really good. i was laughing the whole time. Johnny Knoxville is hilarious.would definitely recommend this movie. Very funny
This is such a sickening movie, just inappropriate even for older audience. It is not even funny! Not at all worth watching.
It was great! Everyone in my family were laughing.it even had a good message not for young kids (my family is teen boys)

I Love this movie, a laugh out loud movie , I plan on watching all the Jackass movies!
I would recommend this movie to anyone who loves to laugh out loud for all to hear!
Very hilarious movie and funny as ever. I love Johnny Knoxville!!!!!!! I've always enjoyed all the movies he played in
A ridiculously unbelievable premise, but if you are a Jackass fan or a Johnny Knoxville fan, this is the movie for you! Most of the plot was silly, but the funny parts were absolutely hilarious!

This movie was super funny. At the end, not knowing that it was a young guy playing the part. I had never laugh this hard since seeing National Lampoon- Christmas with Cheve Chase. These movies deserves 10 stars instead of 5. Even the little fellow I adored except for him dressing up in girls clothes in a scene. Didn't like that part for a kid.

When I saw the trailer for this movie, I couldn't wait for it.  It looked like this would be a masterpiece to share it's place along side other legends such as Animal House, for its comedic genius.  This movie did have some straight up turn your face red, pee your pants, gut busting laughs.  Unfortunately, they were too few and far in between.  This was really a boring movie that was difficult to watch from start to finish.  Maybe it would have been better to pop it in and skip from one gag to the next and cut out the filler.  Sad to say, because I really wanted to like this movie, and I did find parts of it to be the comedic genius I'd hoped to find.
It's a funny movie for adults but not for kids or teenagers. I had to turnit off til my teenagers left the room.

Like jackass, but with a plot going thru the movie, shocking and funny. Johnny Knoxville show a side of him that is a compassionate but still in your face, I can't believe he just said that to his grandson. A fun movie.

Just watched this movie and I was laughing so much that my cheeks hurt.  For a Jackass movie it was awesome.  Didn't expect it to have a plot or anything but that just made the movie that much better.

This was so funny!  But even better than that was the story behind the movie.  The acting was good and the jokes were hillarious.  WHomever did the makeup on Johnny did a wonderful job.  No wonder they were nominated for an Academy Award.

It is a funny movie and it hits its intended audience square in the nose.  The movie has quite a few raunchy parts.  Mostly involving Grandpa's anatomy. So when you think of a Jackass movie you think of mindless pranks with no plot or story-telling substance. This is the completely opposite for this movie. There are still plenty of pranks, similar to those in Borat (intentionally putting unsuspecting people in to uncomfortable/strange situations). However, there is also a storyline in the background that is actually kind of sweet in between the crude moments.

I'd recommend watching it with friends, significant other, or while at home by yourself on a Tuesday night.

While it wasn't an amazing movie, it was very good and I'd give it 4.5/5 stars if possible. I decided to give the other half-star in memory of Ryan Dunn.

when the grandpa character goes over the top, which he does frequently, the filmmakers should've shown more believable, and interactive, witness aka ordinary joe responses.  lots of times the witnesses were believable, merely staring at the politically incorrect grandpa and/or grandson, and whispering amongst themselves. it was also believable when the manager of the convenience store where grandpa was shoplifting got seriously on his case. and a couple of women ignored grandpa, which rang true. other times witnesses should've tried to get away from grandpa, instead of standing there staring. if the filmmakers filmed the scenes exactly how they went down, the team still needed to get something more from some of the witnesses. for instance, in one of the opening scenes when the dead woman fell out of her casket and people attending the funeral kept singing and left her on the floor, that may have been how it actually happened during filming, but to the audience the people attending the funeral were unbelievable in their response; who continues to sing leaving a corpse on the floor that's fallen out of a casket at a funeral they're attending. the witnesses clearly knew a body falling out of a casket was highly suspect, so their choice to do nothing reflected their knowledge that this was a staged event. the filmmakers needed to better assess what would play for a reasonable person in the movie audience. the actor playing grandpa didn't walk or talk like an elderly man. I laughed a few times mostly when grandpa tried to entice the ladies at a male stripper event; the ladies reaction was funny and believable, as well as one of the miffed exotic dancers who thought grandpa was cutting into his action. lots of penis humor and physical humor an 8 year old might like.

The creators of "Jackass" have peaked with this one!!! The ornery "bad grandpa" is a tale of an older gentleman who's wife has just passed and during the "viewing", the daughter pops up with her son and a bag in hand, letting 'grandpa' know, that she's sorry and by the way, 'can you take care of Billy'???? One quickly realizes that 'Billy' is not exactly what Grandpa had planned on, hence the story of taking his grandson to his biological father!!!  What a tale to tell! The antics & problems these two manage to get in are nothing short of spectacular; problem with a soda machine, a 'broken' children's ride, the art of shopping and eating without paying...the list goes on and the funnier it gets!!! Laughed my rear off, some parts are better than others, but I have to honestly say, Knoxville has hit a home-run with this flick/character!!!! Hats off to Johnny Knoxville and "Little Billy" for putting up with him!!!

Jackass Presents: Bad Grandpa is a very funny movie with a heart.  I loved this movie and found myself laughing out loud more than once.  In case you are unfamiliar with the what Bad Grandpa is about; Bad Grandpa is a 2013 hidden camera comedy film written by Jeff Tremaine, Spike Jonze and Johnny Knoxville and directed by Jeff Tremaine.  Bad Grandpa has a loose plot that connects the stunts and pranks together as opposed to the three original Jackass films which had no plot.  The story follows 86-year-old Irving Zisman (Knoxville) takes a trip from Nebraska to North Carolina to take his 8 year-old grandson, Billy, back to his real father.  I am glad I watched this movie and would definitely recommend it to others.

Thank you for reading my review.

I didn't care much for the first "Jackass" film, though a few sequences were truly funny, so I avoided the sequels.  But some
acquaintances told me that "Bad Grandpa" was much better and very funny, so I rented it on Netflix.  I think I laughed as much
and hard through this movie as any I have ever seen, including "Airplane", "Dumb and Dumber", and "Something About Mary".
Rude and Crude, this is not for people who are easily offended, or find so-called "dumb" movies inherently unfunny.  But if you
are open to any comedy that might really make you laugh, and you used to like "Candid Camera", then you will probably like
this one.  Unlike the original Jackass films, this one has a story line going through it, and even approaches moments of slight
poignancy, despite its over the top gross-outs and hilarious sight gags.  The credits are a riot too, so don't turn it off too soon.
I've now seen it 5 times, with different people, and still laugh hard at some of the gags and situations.  The young boy in it
is excellent, and while it is a definite "R", much of it is okay for older children who have seen many PG-13 films.  This one has
no mayhem, violence,  gunplay, or explosions.  Just a lot of sexual innuendoes, and one scene in a black dance club that is
graphic.  But plenty of poor taste, so be advised.
Wasn't expecting to like this but came out of the movie absolutely loving both Irving (Bad Grandpa) & Billy. The sketches & overall comedy was well worth the time spent.

Okay, you're right.  I should've known better than to expect anything other than vulgar bits in a Johnny Knoxville movie.  While the previews were borderline, it was funny enough to persuade us to give it a shot.  What a mistake! If you are like the Jackass movies then you will certainly love Bad Grandpa. On the other hand if you are like me and are not a big fan of the Jackass movies, give Bad Grandpa a chance. It is slightly different because there is a story line to the movie and the whole movie does not consist of ridiculous stunts where the guys in the movie put themselves in danger.
The movie "Bad Grandpa" is hysterical. It combines Knoxville's tendency for ridiculous stunts with a scripted story about a dirty old man and his clever grandson. Johnny Knoxville plays Irving Zisman, the 86-year old grandfather of Billy, who is played by Jackson Nicholl. Irving's wife of 46 years has died, and as "Bad Grandpa" opens, he reacts with a laugh and proclamation of freedom. He then has only one thing on his mind which was made clear when he tells one woman, "I may be too old to stir the gravy, but I can still lick the spoon." At the funeral of Mrs. Zisman, Billy's Mom pawns him off on his grandpa and asks him to take Billy to his dads. The movie then develops into a comical  story of Billy and his Grandpa on a road trip to Billys dads. I would recommend this movie for not only it's hilarious scenes but also because of the chemistry between Knoxville and Nicholl and the movies original comedy.
For the Jackass fans it might take a little while to get used to the scenes in between the pranks where Irving and Billy continue to act out the story line. At first it feels like they should drop the act when no-one else is around but Knoxville and Nicholl never break character. This is an aspect of the movie I really liked. Although the story line is hard to relate to due to the lack of emotion portrayed in the bond between Billy and his Grandpa, they do quickly prove to be an effective double act since Knoxville and Nicholl play off of each other quite well.
Even though the story is not as captivating as other comedies, Bad Grandpa is still an absolute must see original comedy. What made Bad Grandpa original is that other than a few characters such as Billy and Irving, everyone else in the movie were not actors they were real people reacting to what Billy and Irving were doing. Bad Grandpa was able to capture the true reactions of people because they had hidden cameras all over the areas they were shooting. The comedy in Bad Grandpa is not from Knoxville or Nicholl as much as it is from how the real people react to their characters. These are everyday people who react in much the same way that you or I would in the different situations. This aspect of the movie can have a negative impact on the movies story line. Since they're real people, the scenes trail off; either the people walk away, or the shot abruptly ends.
 Although the story line in Bad Grandpa is not award winning the scenes are kind of like a joy-buzzer handshake or a hidden whoopee cushion and sometimes that's all you really need for a good laugh or two. So unless you have a low tolerance for crud and sometimes rude humor Bad Grandpa is a must see comedy.

Note: The film contains strong language, nudity, sexual situations, substance abuse, violence and way-underage drinking.

Im a huge fan of Jackass and their ridiculous stunts. I can watch TruTVs World Dumbest series for an inhumanly long amount of time. As a connoisseur of stupidity gone public I had high expectations for Bad Grandpa. I wasn't disappointed.

A typical Jackass movie is just one stunt after another. I actually liked Bad Grandpa better because the film weaved the stunts in such a way that it told a story. The loose plot was this: a guys wife dies, so he needs to get his grandson away from the childs no-good mother (his daughter) and into the hands of his no-good father.

As you can see, theres plenty of room here for playing pranks on unsuspecting folks (the funeral for Bad Grandpas wife, the behavior of his daughter at the funeral, the video conference in a coffee shop with the son-in-law, and many more.)

Along the way, the usual happens, but its always unpredictable: Grandpa does and says outrageous things and innocent people who witness it are left shaking their heads or gasping in horror. Bad Grandpas grandson was hilarious, too. He even got in on the act with the stunt at the climax. Like the best pranks, there was also a bit of a statement, but Ill say no more so I don't spoil it.

I generally avoid comedies because they are too often some ex-SNL cast member performing excruciatingly long versions of their already done-to-death skits. The Jackass crew and Johnny Knoxville are not so tone-deaf, so I hope to see more like movies this.

A micro-mini spoiler follows: During the credits, you get to see the reactions of the people once they are told that they are part of a film. Those clips were almost as entertaining as the pranks themselves and I wish they had shown more of that.

Larry Nocella
author of novel Loser's Memorial, available on Amazon

The fact that this mess was made into a movie still boggles my mind.  Then, the fact that it was put together by Johnny Knoxville and the JACKASS crew made sense to me.  In movie format, a grandfather offers to take his grandson to his father's to live, since he's too old to take care of him.  Johnny as the old man and that kid made for the best twosome, and the predicaments that they were involved in made this a raunchy, funny comedy.  It's just like that JACKASS show....you can't take ANYTHING for granted, and that's what I loved about this mess!!!!

The two stars was based solely on the fact that the movie was caught between being a typical Jackass prank movie and a road trip bonding film between a surly grandfather and his grandson.  I thought Knoxville and the kid playing his grandson both did a great job when they were playing the road trip roles and I hope their performances here will convince them to do other traditional films.

So, three stars for the road trip portion and one star for the Jackass portion averages out to a solid two.

After watching the trailer, we thought "we gotta see this movie". You know, if you just watch the trailer you're probably covered. The extra footage is fun, but it doesn't add that much.
